intro: Lavatera flava var. minoricensis, commonly known as the Canary Island Lavatera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological and conservation significance.
